title: Can almost anybody in Eritrea understand and speak Tigrinya? - Quora

response.answer_text: I like the word almost because not all of us can speak tigrinya but most of us can understand it. There are 9 ethnic groups in Eritrea. They all have different languages. As tigrinya is the official language almost all they can understand and speak but like kunama, Afar, hdarb, like those ethnic groups who live far from tigrinya speakers so it's hard for them to speak in tigrigna but almost all the people can understand it. Rashaida: Most recent tribe to come to Eritrea from the Arabian Peninsula. They are predominantly nomadic people who live along the Northern Red Sea coast. They are Muslim. Kunama : They are mainly found in villages between the Gash River and in Barentu. They are Nilotic and renowned dancers having developed more than 25 different dancing forms. They are mainly Christians and Muslims with some traditional believers. Hidarb: Cushtic Beja (T’bdawie) semi nomadic pastoralists specializing in raising camels and cattle. They are found in the western lowlands. it's hard sometimes to find tigrinya speakers among those ethnic groups who lives far from tigrinya speakers, although most people can understand it.

I'm Eritrean.  I speak Tigrinya.  So, the answer is almost, yes. “ዳርጋ መብዛሕትና” That past line is Tigrinya that translates to, “almost all of us”, by the way. Tigrinya has been a lingua franca ever since Eritrea’s independence, alongside Arabic and English. Eritrea has 9 languages, namely Tigrinya, Tigre, Kunama, Nara, B’daweet(Hdarb), Blin, Afar, Saho and Arabic. Not only that, Tigrinya originates from an ancient language called Geez, which gave rise to Tigrinya and Tigre - and Amharic, a language spoken in Ethiopia. The foremost two languages—Tigrinya and Tigre are the largest languages in terms of number of native speakers in Eritrea and are about ~60% similar because they share many words. I think that enables almost all Eritreans atleast to be able to understand and be able to communicate in Tigrinya. So, unless you are in an area that's Not in Eritrea, Tigrinya would work.
